title: Deuteronomy Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Deuteronomy chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Deuteronomy Chapter 17.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:1, what kind of bullock or sheep shall you not sacrifice to the LORD?
options: One with a blemish or evilfavouredness
One that is young and healthy
One that is white and pure
One that is older than three years
questions.correctAnswer: One with a blemish or evilfavouredness
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:1 states that you shall not sacrifice to the LORD any bullock or sheep with a blemish or evilfavouredness because it is an abomination to God.

questions.question: In Deuteronomy 17:5, what is the punishment for a man or woman who serves other gods?
options: They shall be stoned with stones till they die
They shall be exiled from the community
They shall be imprisoned for life
They shall pay a fine to the priests
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be stoned with stones till they die
questions.explanation: Verse 5 commands that a person who worships other gods be brought to the gates and stoned to death.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:6, how many witnesses are required to put a person to death?
options: Two or three witnesses
One witness
Four witnesses
No witnesses are required
questions.correctAnswer: Two or three witnesses
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that at the mouth of two or three witnesses a person worthy of death shall be put to death, but not at the mouth of one witness.

questions.question: What shall the people do after the witnesses put the guilty person to death, according to Deuteronomy 17:7?
options: All the people shall lay their hands on him to put him to death
They shall sing praises to the LORD
They shall forgive and accept the person back
They shall offer sacrifices for forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: All the people shall lay their hands on him to put him to death
questions.explanation: Verse 7 explains that after the witnesses, all the people shall put their hands on the person to execute him, thus putting evil away from among them.

questions.question: If a matter is too hard to judge within your gates, where shall you go according to Deuteronomy 17:8?
options: To the place the LORD your God shall choose
To your nearest city
To the elders of your tribe
To the king immediately
questions.correctAnswer: To the place the LORD your God shall choose
questions.explanation: Verse 8 instructs to go to the place chosen by the LORD your God when a difficult judgment arises.

questions.question: Who shall you consult in the place the LORD chooses to get a judgment, according to Deuteronomy 17:9?
options: The priests the Levites and the judge
The elders and prophets
The king and his counselors
The scribes and teachers
questions.correctAnswer: The priests the Levites and the judge
questions.explanation: Verse 9 says you shall come to the priests the Levites and the judge to inquire and receive the sentence of judgment.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 17:11 say about declining from the sentence given by the priests and judges?
options: You shall not decline to the right hand nor to the left
You may decline if you feel it is unjust
You should seek a second opinion
You shall write your own judgment
questions.correctAnswer: You shall not decline to the right hand nor to the left
questions.explanation: Verse 11 commands obedience to the judgment given without deviation to the right or left.

questions.question: What is the consequence for a man who does presumptuously and does not obey the priest or judge, according to Deuteronomy 17:12?
options: He shall die
He shall be fined
He shall be exiled
He shall be imprisoned
questions.correctAnswer: He shall die
questions.explanation: Verse 12 clearly states that a man who presumptuously disobeys the priest or judge shall be put to death.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:15, who shall be set as king over Israel?
options: One whom the LORD your God shall choose from among your brethren
A stranger from another nation
The strongest warrior
The richest man
questions.correctAnswer: One whom the LORD your God shall choose from among your brethren
questions.explanation: Verse 15 directs that the king must be chosen by the LORD and be from among the brethren, not a stranger.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:16, what is the king prohibited from multiplying?
options: Horses, wives, silver, and gold
Only horses
Only wives
Only silver and gold
questions.correctAnswer: Horses, wives, silver, and gold
questions.explanation: Verses 16 and 17 collectively prohibit the king from multiplying horses, wives, silver, and gold to avoid pride and turning away from God.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 17:13, all the people shall hear and fear and do no more presumptuously.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states that all the people shall hear, fear, and refrain from presumptuous behavior.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 17:14 says you may set any stranger as king over you.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 15 explicitly forbids setting a stranger as king; he must be from among your brethren.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 17:19, the king shall read the law all the days of his life to fear the LORD and keep the law.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 19 commands the king to read the law daily to learn to fear God and obey the statutes.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Deuteronomy 17:20: 'That his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may ______.'
options: prolong his days in his kingdom
grow rich and powerful
establish many horses
destroy his enemies
questions.correctAnswer: prolong his days in his kingdom
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:20 explains that the king must not be proud or deviate from the commandment so that he may prolong his days in his kingdom.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:18, what shall the king write when he sits upon his throne?
options: A copy of this law out of that which is before the priests the Levites
A new law for the people
A record of his victories
A list of his wealth and horses
questions.correctAnswer: A copy of this law out of that which is before the priests the Levites
questions.explanation: Verse 18 commands the king to write a copy of the law from the priests the Levites to keep it with him.

medium.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Deuteronomy Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with integrity in worship. Based on Deuteronomy 17:1-5, what biblical truth would you share about acceptable offerings to God?
options: Offerings must be without blemish because God detests imperfect sacrifices
Any offering is acceptable as long as it is given sincerely
Offerings should be made only in private
Only grain offerings are required, not animals
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings must be without blemish because God detests imperfect sacrifices
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:1 teaches that one must not sacrifice a bullock or sheep with blemishes because it is an abomination to the LORD. Verses 2-5 emphasize the seriousness of obedience and purity in worship.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 17:6-7 teach about the importance of justice and witness in the church community?
options: A person is put to death only on the testimony of two or three witnesses to ensure fairness
One witness is sufficient for capital punishment
Judges can decide based on their own opinion without witnesses
The accused must confess before witnesses
questions.correctAnswer: A person is put to death only on the testimony of two or three witnesses to ensure fairness
questions.explanation: Verses 6-7 highlight the need for multiple witnesses before imposing the death penalty, promoting justice and preventing false accusations. This helps maintain integrity and fairness within the community.

questions.question: A believer faces a difficult judgment case in their church. According to Deuteronomy 17:8-13, what should be done to ensure proper resolution?
options: Seek judgment from the priests and judges in the place God chooses and obey their ruling
Decide based on majority vote among the people
Resolve the matter privately without involving leaders
Allow the accused to choose the judge
questions.correctAnswer: Seek judgment from the priests and judges in the place God chooses and obey their ruling
questions.explanation: Verses 8-13 instruct believers to bring difficult matters to the appointed priests and judges, obey their decisions strictly, and not deviate, which teaches humility, respect for authority, and obedience to God's law.

questions.question: What does Deuteronomy 17:12-13 teach about the consequences of disrespecting spiritual and judicial authority?
options: One who disrespects the priest or judge shall be put to death to remove evil from Israel
Disrespect leads to a warning only
The community should forgive without penalty
The offender should be fined
questions.correctAnswer: One who disrespects the priest or judge shall be put to death to remove evil from Israel
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 emphasize that presumptuous disobedience to God's appointed leaders results in death, illustrating the seriousness of submission and reverence for spiritual authority for the community's holiness.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 17:14-15 guide believers in choosing leadership within the church or community?
options: Choose a king whom God selects from among your brothers, not a stranger
Select any person skilled in leadership regardless of background
Elect leaders by popularity
Allow foreign leaders to rule for wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Choose a king whom God selects from among your brothers, not a stranger
questions.explanation: Verses 14-15 teach that leadership must be divinely chosen and from within the community, promoting trust in God’s guidance and maintaining unity and identity in the faith family.

questions.question: A church leader is tempted to increase his wealth and family excessively. What biblical principle from Deuteronomy 17:16-17 addresses this temptation?
options: A king must not multiply horses, wives, or wealth to keep his heart from turning away from God
A leader should seek wealth to support the ministry
Multiplying wives is a sign of strength
Increasing horses and silver is encouraged for defense
questions.correctAnswer: A king must not multiply horses, wives, or wealth to keep his heart from turning away from God
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 warn leaders against accumulating horses, wives, and wealth to prevent pride and turning away from God, teaching humility, contentment, and faithful devotion.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17:18-20, what spiritual discipline is required of a king to maintain humility and obedience?
options: He must write and read a copy of the law daily to fear the LORD and obey His commands
He should delegate reading scripture to others
He may read the law only during festivals
He is not required to study the law personally
questions.correctAnswer: He must write and read a copy of the law daily to fear the LORD and obey His commands
questions.explanation: Verses 18-20 instruct the king to keep God's law close and study it daily, fostering reverence, obedience, humility, and a long-lasting kingdom.

questions.question: True or False: Deuteronomy 17 teaches that personal obedience to God's law is essential for leaders to avoid pride and maintain long life in their kingdom.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:20 explains that reading and obeying the law keeps the king humble and aligned with God's commands, which leads to prolonged days and blessings.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 17:6, a single witness is sufficient to convict someone deserving death.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:6 clearly states that the testimony of two or three witnesses is required for a death sentence, ensuring fairness and preventing false accusations.

questions.question: A fellow believer asks why God requires multiple witnesses before punishment. Based on Deuteronomy 17, what biblical reason would you share?
options: To ensure the matter is certain and just, protecting against false accusations
Because one witness is not reliable in any case
To speed up the judgment process
To allow the accused to deny charges effectively
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure the matter is certain and just, protecting against false accusations
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:4-6 shows that thorough investigation and multiple witnesses confirm the truth, ensuring justice and protecting the community from wrongful punishment.

questions.question: When faced with a hard judgment, how does Deuteronomy 17 instruct believers to respond to God's appointed leaders?
options: Obey their decisions without turning to the right or left
Appeal to higher authorities immediately
Ignore their rulings if personal opinion differs
Delay judgment until all agree
questions.correctAnswer: Obey their decisions without turning to the right or left
questions.explanation: Verses 10-11 emphasize strict obedience to the judges' rulings, teaching humility, trust, and submission to God's established authority.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise in judgment because of personal bias. What teaching from Deuteronomy 17:11 would help correct this mindset?
options: Do not deviate from the sentence given by the priests and judges to maintain justice
Judgment should favor close friends
Compromise is acceptable to keep peace
Judges should ask the people for approval
questions.correctAnswer: Do not deviate from the sentence given by the priests and judges to maintain justice
questions.explanation: Verse 11 stresses obedience to the judgment given, prohibiting deviation, which guards against partiality and promotes integrity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Deuteronomy 17:15 instructs that the king must be chosen from among __________.
options: thy brethren
foreign nations
priests only
wealthy men
questions.correctAnswer: thy brethren
questions.explanation: Verse 15 specifies that the king must be one from among the brethren, underscoring the importance of shared faith and community.

questions.question: How does Deuteronomy 17:12 apply to dealing with rebellious attitudes towards God’s appointed leaders in the church today?
options: Rebellion against leaders is serious and should be addressed to preserve holiness
Leaders must tolerate all disobedience
Rebellion is a private matter with no consequences
Only verbal warnings are necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Rebellion against leaders is serious and should be addressed to preserve holiness
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states that presumptuous disobedience leads to death to remove evil, teaching the church to take rebellion seriously for communal purity.

questions.question: A believer asks how to guard against pride in leadership. What practical advice does Deuteronomy 17:18-20 provide?
options: Regularly read and meditate on God’s law to keep humble and obedient
Avoid reading the law to prevent confusion
Delegate spiritual reading to others
Focus on building wealth to show success
questions.correctAnswer: Regularly read and meditate on God’s law to keep humble and obedient
questions.explanation: Verses 18-20 instruct leaders to write and read the law daily to fear God, obey His commands, and avoid pride, ensuring spiritual discipline.

hard.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Deuteronomy Chapter 17.

questions.question: What is forbidden when sacrificing a bullock or sheep to the LORD according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Sacrificing an animal with a blemish or evilfavouredness
Sacrificing an animal that is too young
Sacrificing an animal without blood
Sacrificing an animal during the daytime
questions.correctAnswer: Sacrificing an animal with a blemish or evilfavouredness
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:1 forbids offering to the LORD any bullock or sheep with blemishes or evilfavouredness, calling it an abomination.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17, what is the penalty for a man or woman found worshipping other gods?
options: They shall be stoned to death
They shall be exiled
They shall pay a fine
They shall be imprisoned
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be stoned to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:5 commands bringing the offender to the gates and stoning them to death for worshipping other gods.

questions.question: What is required before a person can be put to death according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Testimony of two or three witnesses
Testimony of one witness
Confession of the accused
Judgment by the king
questions.correctAnswer: Testimony of two or three witnesses
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:6 states that at the mouth of two or three witnesses a person worthy of death shall be put to death, but not by one witness alone.

questions.question: In cases too difficult to judge locally, where does Deuteronomy 17 instruct people to go for judgment?
options: The place the LORD shall choose
The king's palace
The nearest city
The elders of the tribe
questions.correctAnswer: The place the LORD shall choose
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:8 directs that difficult matters be brought to the place the LORD chooses for judgment.

questions.question: Who are to give the sentence of judgment at the place the LORD chooses, as described in Deuteronomy 17?
options: The priests the Levites and the judge
The king and his advisors
The elders of the city
The prophets
questions.correctAnswer: The priests the Levites and the judge
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:9 specifies that the priests the Levites and the judge shall show the sentence of judgment at the chosen place.

questions.question: What must the people do when they receive the sentence from the priests and judge at the LORD's chosen place?
options: Observe and do according to the sentence without declining
Appeal to the king for a review
Ignore the sentence if they disagree
Consult prophets for confirmation
questions.correctAnswer: Observe and do according to the sentence without declining
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:10-11 instructs the people to follow the judgment without turning to the right or left.

questions.question: What is the consequence for a man who presumptuously refuses to listen to the priest or judge according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: He shall be put to death
He shall be excommunicated
He shall be fined
He shall be publicly rebuked
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:12 states that a man who presumptuously disobeys the priest or judge shall die.

questions.question: Who shall the king be chosen from according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: One of thy brethren
A foreigner
A prophet
A warrior
questions.correctAnswer: One of thy brethren
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:15 commands that the king must be chosen from among the brethren, not a stranger.

questions.question: Which of the following is the king forbidden to multiply according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Horses, wives, silver and gold
Levites, priests, and prophets
Cities, armies, and altars
Servants, chariots, and weapons
questions.correctAnswer: Horses, wives, silver and gold
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:16-17 prohibits the king from multiplying horses, wives, silver, and gold to prevent his heart from turning away from God.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the king writing a copy of the law to keep with him, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: To learn to fear the LORD and obey His commands
To display his wisdom to his subjects
To use it as a symbol of power
To compare it with other nations' laws
questions.correctAnswer: To learn to fear the LORD and obey His commands
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:18-19 explains the king must read the law daily to fear God and keep His commandments.

questions.question: What is the intended result if the king keeps the law and commands without turning aside, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: He and his children will prolong their days in the kingdom
He will gain wealth and honor
He will defeat all enemies
He will be remembered forever
questions.correctAnswer: He and his children will prolong their days in the kingdom
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:20 promises longevity for the king and his descendants if he obeys the law without deviation.

questions.question: Deuteronomy 17:6 establishes a legal principle requiring two or three witnesses for a death sentence. Which New Testament event reflects this principle in Jesus' trial?
options: The Sanhedrin seeking multiple witnesses against Jesus
Pilate's interrogation of Jesus alone
Peter's denial of Jesus
Paul's conversion on the road to Damascus
questions.correctAnswer: The Sanhedrin seeking multiple witnesses against Jesus
questions.explanation: The requirement of multiple witnesses in Deuteronomy 17:6 is reflected in the Sanhedrin's attempt to find two or three witnesses against Jesus in the Gospels.

questions.question: True or False: According to Deuteronomy 17, a king is allowed to return to Egypt to acquire horses for his army.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:16 explicitly forbids the king from multiplying horses or causing the people to return to Egypt for horses.

questions.question: What is the significance of the king writing the law by himself as stated in Deuteronomy 17:18, in historical and theological context?
options: It ensures the king personally commits to God's law, preventing tyranny and fostering humility
It shows the king’s literary skill
It allows the king to alter the law as he wishes
It was a common practice among ancient Near Eastern kings to write their own laws
questions.correctAnswer: It ensures the king personally commits to God's law, preventing tyranny and fostering humility
questions.explanation: Writing the law personally symbolizes the king's submission to divine authority, guarding against pride and abuse of power (Deuteronomy 17:18-20).

questions.question: Deuteronomy 17:4-7 describes the procedure for addressing idolatry within Israel. What literary device does this sequence resemble?
options: Chiasm emphasizing investigation, confirmation, and execution
Parallelism contrasting sin and punishment
Typology foreshadowing New Testament judgment
Metaphor illustrating purity and holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm emphasizing investigation, confirmation, and execution
questions.explanation: The passage structures the process in a chiasm: report (v4), investigation (v4), confirmation (v4), and punishment (v5-7), highlighting judicial rigor.

questions.question: How does the prohibition against multiplying wives in Deuteronomy 17:17 reflect concerns found elsewhere in the Old Testament?
options: It addresses the danger of idolatry and heart turning away from God, as seen in Solomon's later life
It promotes monogamy as a social ideal
It forbids any family expansion for the king
It is a cultural custom unrelated to religious concerns
questions.correctAnswer: It addresses the danger of idolatry and heart turning away from God, as seen in Solomon's later life
questions.explanation: The restriction reflects a concern that multiple wives could lead a king to idolatry, foreshadowing Solomon's downfall described in 1 Kings 11.

theological.title: Deuteronomy Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Deuteronomy Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 17, what kind of animal is forbidden to be sacrificed to the LORD because it is an abomination?
options: A bullock or sheep with a blemish
A clean dove
A young calf without blemish
A goat without spot
questions.correctAnswer: A bullock or sheep with a blemish
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:1 forbids offering to God any bullock or sheep with a blemish as it is an abomination. This aligns with Leviticus 22:20-25 and reflects God's holiness requiring spotless offerings (cf. 1 Peter 1:19, Hebrews 9:14).

questions.question: What is the prescribed penalty for a man or woman who worships other gods, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: They shall be stoned to death
They shall be exiled
They shall be fined
They shall be imprisoned
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be stoned to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:5 commands the stoning of anyone who worships other gods, showing the seriousness of idolatry, consistent with Exodus 22:20 and reinforced in the New Testament's condemnation of idolatry (1 Corinthians 10:14, Galatians 5:20).

questions.question: How many witnesses are required to put someone to death according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Two or three witnesses
One witness
Four witnesses
No witnesses are needed
questions.correctAnswer: Two or three witnesses
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:6 emphasizes the principle of multiple witnesses for capital punishment, reflecting the justice principle established in Deuteronomy 19:15 and affirmed in the New Testament (2 Corinthians 13:1).

questions.question: In difficult judicial matters, where does Deuteronomy 17 instruct the people to seek judgment?
options: The place which the LORD shall choose
The nearest city gate
The oldest man in the community
A foreign king
questions.correctAnswer: The place which the LORD shall choose
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:8 directs difficult cases to be taken to the place God chooses, indicating divine authority in judgment, consistent with the centralization of worship in Jerusalem (1 Kings 8:29, Psalms 2:10-12).

questions.question: Who are to provide the sentence of judgment in the place the LORD chooses?
options: Priests the Levites and the judge
The king alone
The elders of the city
The prophets
questions.correctAnswer: Priests the Levites and the judge
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:9 specifies priests and a judge as the authorities for judgment, showing the role of the Levitical priesthood and judiciary in God's covenant community, paralleling the priestly-judicial roles in Ezra 7:6 and Hebrews 7:11-14.

questions.question: What must the people do if they refuse to obey the priest or judge's sentence, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: They shall be put to death
They shall be excommunicated
They shall be fined
They shall be forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:12 warns that presumptuous disobedience to priest or judge results in death, emphasizing the seriousness of covenant obedience, consistent with Numbers 15:30-31 and Hebrews 10:28-31.

questions.question: Who is permitted to be set as king over Israel according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: One from among your brethren whom the LORD chooses
Any foreign prince
A wealthy merchant
A prophet
questions.correctAnswer: One from among your brethren whom the LORD chooses
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:15 requires the king to be an Israelite chosen by God, highlighting divine sovereignty in leadership selection, consistent with 1 Samuel 16:1-13 and the messianic hope fulfilled in Christ, the true King (Luke 1:32).

questions.question: What practice is the king forbidden to multiply according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Horses, wives, silver and gold
Priests, prophets, and Levites
Cities and armies
Sacrifices and festivals
questions.correctAnswer: Horses, wives, silver and gold
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:16-17 restricts the king from multiplying horses (military power), wives (political alliances), and wealth, to prevent pride and apostasy, in line with 1 Kings 11:1-4 and Jesus’ teaching on servant leadership (Mark 10:42-45).

questions.question: What is the king commanded to do with the law once he sits on the throne, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Write a copy of the law and read it all his life
Destroy all copies of the law
Teach the law to the priests only
Ignore the law and follow his own counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Write a copy of the law and read it all his life
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:18-19 instructs the king to have a personal copy of the law and meditate on it daily, promoting humility and obedience, resonating with Joshua 1:8 and Psalm 1:2-3 as the path to godly leadership.

questions.question: What is the purpose for the king reading the law daily as stated in Deuteronomy 17?
options: To learn to fear the LORD and obey His commands
To increase his political power
To impress the people with knowledge
To teach the law to foreign nations
questions.correctAnswer: To learn to fear the LORD and obey His commands
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:19 clarifies the king reads the law to cultivate reverence for God and faithful obedience, reflecting the biblical theme of the fear of the LORD as the beginning of wisdom (Proverbs 9:10; Ecclesiastes 12:13).

questions.question: What warning is given about the king's heart in Deuteronomy 17?
options: His heart must not be lifted above his brethren or turn aside from the commandment
His heart must seek to dominate other nations
His heart must be filled with pride and wealth
His heart must disregard the law to maintain power
questions.correctAnswer: His heart must not be lifted above his brethren or turn aside from the commandment
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:20 warns against pride and disobedience in kingship, emphasizing humility and covenant faithfulness, consistent with Proverbs 16:18 and the humility exemplified by Christ (Philippians 2:5-8).

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal for the king obeying the law faithfully as stated in Deuteronomy 17?
options: He and his children may prolong their days in the kingdom
He may become wealthier than other kings
He may conquer all neighboring nations
He may live in luxury
questions.correctAnswer: He and his children may prolong their days in the kingdom
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:20 links faithful obedience to longevity of reign, illustrating covenant blessings tied to obedience (cf. Psalm 112:1-2, Proverbs 3:1-2, and Jesus’ prayer for enduring kingdom in John 17:11).

questions.question: What kind of gods are prohibited from being worshipped according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: The sun, moon, or any of the host of heaven
God the Father and Jesus Christ
Angels and archangels
The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
questions.correctAnswer: The sun, moon, or any of the host of heaven
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:3 forbids worshiping celestial bodies, highlighting exclusive worship of Yahweh, consistent with Isaiah 45:5-7 and New Testament affirmations of monotheism (1 Corinthians 8:4-6).

questions.question: What role do the witnesses have in the execution of the person worthy of death?
options: Their hands are first upon him to put him to death
They must first pray for mercy
They act as executioners but do not touch the person
They only testify and do not participate
questions.correctAnswer: Their hands are first upon him to put him to death
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:7 states the witnesses lay hands first to execute, demonstrating accountability and involvement, paralleling Numbers 35:30 and Hebrews 10:28 emphasizing just judgment.

questions.question: What is the community's expected response after hearing the sentence and punishment for disobedience in Deuteronomy 17?
options: They shall hear, fear, and not act presumptuously anymore
They shall rebel against the authorities
They shall ignore the sentence
They shall appoint a new judge
questions.correctAnswer: They shall hear, fear, and not act presumptuously anymore
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:13 teaches that hearing the punishment should instill fear and obedience among the people, consistent with the biblical principle that the fear of the LORD leads to wisdom and obedience (Psalm 34:11-14, Proverbs 1:7).

questions.question: Why is the king forbidden to cause the people to return to Egypt to multiply horses, according to Deuteronomy 17?
options: Because the LORD said you shall not return that way anymore
Because Egypt was a friendly ally
Because horses are useless in battle
Because the people prefer walking
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD said you shall not return that way anymore
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 17:16 forbids the king from sending people back to Egypt for horses, emphasizing reliance on God rather than worldly powers, consistent with Exodus 14:13-14 and Isaiah 31:1.
